title: College Ranking what do you think
content:
Is this ranking reasonable considering perception in this group

1. **IIIT H/BITS Pilani**
2. **BITS Goa/Hyderabad, IIIT D, IIIT B**
3. **RV College/BIT Mesra**
4. **Thapar/VIT/MIT/PES /BMSCE/Ramaiya - All Main campus // There might be some college from Pune and Bombay**
5. **Thapar Dera Bassi, VIT Chennai, PEC Electronic City**
6. **JSS/Dayanand Sagar/BMSIT/**
7. **BIT, RVITM,NIE**
8. **Nitte Meenakshi**

comments.body: This ranking is for private colleges only.
pes ec = rr , rest of it true

Firstly, no ranking system is accurate. Every ranking, including NIRF, is flawed to a large extent. There is no point trying to rank colleges beyond the T1 status which IITs/BITS/NIT/IISc have. 

Secondly, why are both PES campuses ranked differently? They are objectively the same: placements, degree, etc. Since when did subjective parameters become a differentiator? That's bias.

Thirdly, everyone and their mother knows that PES only competes with Stanford and South Korea. We even unveiled our own flag yesterday. PESU League >>> Ivy League. /s
What's the ranking based on? Placements and campus?
Placement is the main parameter followed by perception.
I agree but perception is one of the parameter here.
Aight looks good.

Regarding placements, you should ideally compare the median of the base pay. Using average or CTC will greatly skew these results. Further, since the number of students varies greatly across these colleges, unless you look closely, you will only see biased results. This is the same reason a lot of people think RR campus gets better placements when the reality is that RR simply has more people sitting for a T1 company compared to EC. 

If you're going by reputation, then yeah sure I guess your list is okay. Although you should know that from a higher education point of view for MS, everything other than IIT/NIT/BITS/IIIT/IISc gets put into the same bracket, and there is no distinction *between* different different IITs, between different NITs etc.
all bits campuses fall at the same place. you get the same degree irrespective of campus and placements are centralised.

Ofc not to say RVCE is bad or anything: its a great college. But seems like if you put together all the factors Manipal might have more going for it than RV does.
